executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

Online jewelry and watch sales have grown, with the popularity of online shopping driving the industry's strong revenue performance. Demand for jewelry and watches has increased as consumers with higher rates of disposable income have increasingly purchased higher-priced discretionary goods. Despite the economic disruptions brought on by the pandemic, online jewelry and watch sales continued to grow as the popularity of online shopping skyrocketed and consumers with higher incomes continued to make luxury purchases. Overall, revenue is set to grow at an estimated CAGR of 9.2% to $14.3 billion through 2024, including an increase of 0.1% drop that year alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Jewelry Sellers Focus on Serving Higher-Income Buyers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Fluctuations in macroeconomic conditions in recent years have negatively impacted downstream buyers, particularly those with lower disposable income, as they have fewer resources to allocate toward making luxury purchases like jewelry. High-earning consumers, those making more than $100,000 a year, generate the largest share of revenue, accounting for more than 60.0% of sales. Because of this, retailers have experienced revenue growth in recent years despite unfavorable macroeconomic conditions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fluctuating Input Prices Support Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Jewelry prices directly impact jewelry and watch revenue. The price of precious metals and stones, including gold, silver and diamonds, influence upstream manufacturers' production costs and, therefore, jewelry selling prices. Because retailers largely target consumers with higher disposable income, drastic jewelry price increases amid jumping input prices have heavily contributed to rapid revenue gains, particularly as consumer preferences switched toward online shopping.

Online retailers have several advantages over traditional brick-and-mortar stores. These sellers have significantly lower start-up costs and typically lower rent and utility costs, as they don't operate out of a physical retail location but can operate from their warehouse. Online retailers also have better access to real-time data, which enables them to better price their products and manage inventory.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Growing Demand Drives Expansion and Competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While consumers have remained slightly reluctant to purchase high-priced goods from e-commerce platforms, positive economic growth, coupled with rising selling prices, has kept revenue growing. Though popular traditional jewelry retailers, including Tiffany & Co., Signet Jewelers and Macy's, have adopted online platforms prior to the current period, the industry's fastest-growing sellers are companies that specialize in e-commerce.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue is Set to Continue Rising, Although at a Slower Rate
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ongoing economic recovery is expected to continue over the coming years, with rising disposable income, lower inflation and growing consumer confidence boosting discretionary purchases. The industry's high-priced, traditional revenue drivers, such as engagement rings, diamond jewelry and gold pieces, will experience a lag in demand as consumers explore alternative materials, including lab-grown diamonds and more affordable stones.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Internal Competition Intensifies as the Industry Grows Popular
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growing demand for lower-priced options will continue attracting new online sellers to the industry, particularly for stores carrying more affordable pieces that adapt to consumer preferences.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Traditional Retailers Will Expand Their E-Commerce Capabilities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Globally successful brick-and-mortar retailers have increasingly boosted their online presence. This trend will continue, with more well-known and respected jewelers entering the online market. The influx of these retailers will add to already mounting competition among smaller sellers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Ethical Transparency is Becoming More Important to Downstream Buyers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumers become increasingly aware of and concerned about the ethical implications of their purchases, jewelry stores must demonstrate a commitment to selling ethically sourced pieces. More jewelry stores will offer pieces with fair trade gold, gems, recycled metals and lab-grown diamonds.

industry_definition: Online jewelry and watch retailers sell fine jewelry, artificial jewelry, watches and costume jewelry over the internet. Operators include online-only retailers and brick-and-mortar stores that have an online presence.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Price and quality are the main competitive strategies for online sellers. Because consumers can easily compare online retailers, offering competitive pricing or unique and quality products is key to success.
Brick-and-mortar and department stores offer similar products. These retailers compete with online jewelry and watch retailers mainly through in-person customer service.

Consumer preferences favoring online sales contribute to the health of the industry. Consumers feeling more comfortable making large purchases online boosts revenue for online jewelry and watch retailers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes consumers from households earning less than $40,000 annually. This demographic accounts for the largest segment of the US population but the smallest share of industry revenue largely because of their limited disposable income.

This segment includes consumers from households earning between $40,000 and $100,000 annually. These consumers purchase a range of watches and jewelry, including costume jewelry, watches and specialty pieces. These buyers tend to buy more expensive items than households earning less than $40,000, and so account for a larger share of revenue.

This segment includes consumers from households earning more than $100,000 annually. Despite accounting for a smaller share of the population, consumers making more than $100,000 generate the most significant revenue because of their frequent purchases of fine jewelry and watches. Individuals in this segment purchase precious metal jewelry, diamonds, diamond-encrusted watches and other such items, which are significantly more expensive than costume jewelry and generate much higher profit for retailers.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes watches made from all types of metals and materials. Watch prices range significantly, with some costing as little as $20.0 and others reaching more than $20,000.0.

This segment includes high-priced items containing diamonds and other gemstones. The high price tags of these products make specialty jewelry the largest segment. Wedding and engagement rings are included in this segment.

The fashion and other jewelry segment includes jewelry made from gold, silver, platinum and other semiprecious metals, as well as artificial and costume jewelry. Jewelry in this segment is more affordable than specialty pieces.

tier_1_suppliers: Jewelry & Watch Wholesaling in the US
Paper Product Manufacturing in the US
Office Stationery Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Gold & Silver Ore Mining in the US
Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Mineral Product Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer preferences favoring online shopping directly impact online jewelry and watch sales. As more consumers turn to online shopping due to time constraints, the availability of jewelry and watches on the internet has grown. The convenience and accessibility offered by online retailers have led to a higher percentage of services conducted online, representing a potential opportunity for the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The West is the largest region by establishment for online jewelry and watch retailers. California, leading the West in population, also boasts a higher-than-average concentration of these retailers.

The Southeast hosts the largest percentage of the US population, increasing retailers' potential customer base. As the largest state by establishment in the Southeast, Florida stands out as a particularly important market.

The Mid-Atlantic region is a major hub for online jewelry and watches sellers. This area is the third-largest in terms of establishment numbers. High incomes, proximity to ports, and a large urban population make it attractive. However, high rent costs due to the dense population can deter smaller online retailers from setting up shop in the region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) oversees fair advertising and business practices in the jewelry and watch industry. Sellers must use precise descriptions, disclosing details like gemstone treatments or metal quality standards.

Section 1502 of the Dodd-Frank Act mandates that publicly traded retailers disclose their use of certain conflict minerals. In August 2012, regulations were adopted, requiring annual disclosures on the origins of these minerals, often used in jewelry and watches.

Federal regulations mandate all gold, silver and platinum jewelry sold in the US to be hallmarked with purity marks. For example, gold is stamped with its karat purity. These regulations ensure consumers receive the precious metal content they're paying for, fostering transparency and trust in online transactions.

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) mandates transparency in how sellers collect and use consumer data. Online retailers must have clear privacy policies and secure data handling methods. Non-compliance risks hefty fines and loss of consumer trust.

The Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act mandates that jewelry and watches sellers provide clear, detailed warranty terms. This regulation impacts online transactions by requiring sellers to offer straightforward information about warranty coverage, duration and claim processes.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
regulations_points.regulation_description: Online jewelry and watch retailers in the US face regulations under the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement, mandated by the Streamlined Sales Tax Governing Board. This agreement requires these retailers to collect sales tax from customers in participating states, regardless of physical presence.

The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) mandates a federal minimum wage of $7.25 per hour and imposes strict child labor regulations. Businesses employing people under 18 must adhere to rules regarding wages, work hours and permitted tasks.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
regulations_points.regulation_description: OSHA mandates various guidelines to ensure safe and healthful working conditions. The regulations cover safety equipment requirements, hazardous material handling, building maintenance standards and medical and first aid protocols.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Industry assistance level is low and steady
barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low and steady.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry assistance level is low and steady

basis_points.basis_title: Price and quality are main competitive strategies
basis_points.basis_description: Price and quality are the main competitive strategies for online sellers. Because consumers can easily compare online retailers, offering competitive pricing or unique and quality products is key to success.

basis_points.basis_title: Brick-and-mortar stores compete through in-person service
basis_points.basis_description: Brick-and-mortar and department stores offer similar products. These retailers compete with online jewelry and watch retailers mainly through in-person customer service.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Economies of scale enable large companies to price their products more competitively by reducing operational costs efficiently. As a result, large brands like Amazon become more appealing to consumers looking for a better deal.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Larger companies can allocate more resources
concentration_points.concentration_description: Larger companies can allocate more resources to enhance their online channels, increasing their share of industry revenue. These established brands draw more customers than newer, lesser-known companies.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consumers can easily compare online retailers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Consumers can easily compare prices across various online retailers, making it crucial for smaller businesses to offer competitive pricing. However, small retailers can find it challenging to compete with the broad product range and prices of larger sellers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low barriers allow new entrants frequently
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry's relatively low barriers to entry allow new companies to enter frequently. Smaller retailers might attract customers by offering unique products that large corporations don't carry, helping them stand out.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit is directly impacted by changes in consumer behavior, as demand for new jewelry and watches grows when disposable income and consumer confidence are elevated. Similarly, volatile input prices directly impact purchase costs, pressuring profit.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: ONLINE RETAILERS HAVE LOWER WAGE COSTS THAN TRADITIONAL RETAILERS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online retailers typically maintain lower wage costs than their brick-and-mortar counterparts. Once operational, online stores do not require much labor-heavy maintenance, and salaries account for a relatively small portion of.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE PRICE OF GOLD AND SILVER AFFECTS PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchasing costs historically represent the largest expense for online sellers. Retailers' purchases include finished jewelry pieces, watches, loose gemstones, unfinished jewelry, parts and shipping materials.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: SELLERS MUST ALLOCATE SIGNIFICANT RESOURCES TOWARD MARKETING
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online sellers increasingly rely on branding, marketing and advertising efforts to generate revenue. As the industry grows, retailers must allocate a considerable portion of revenue to marketing to stand out from the competition.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The initial labor costs are substantial and often occur before a website's launch, as higher-paid engineers and web developers are required to develop the website. Employees are also needed for customer service.

Online sellers are capital-intensive because they need to make substantial investments in inventory and technology, including acquiring and deploying advanced software and hardware and securing high-bandwidth hosting services.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in consumer behavior affect volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Jewelry and watch revenue growth is tightly linked to per capita disposable income, consumer spending and the shifting consumer preferences favoring online retail platforms. Macroeconomic conditions have a stronger influence over sales of jewelry and watches made of precious metals and stones.

The unstable nature of input prices, especially for precious metals like gold, silver and platinum, leads to significant revenue volatility as retailers pass increased costs onto buyers. These commodities are heavily influenced by global supply and demand dynamics, which shift quickly.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Product Innovation is Limited to What Products Online Retailers Offer
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online retailers enhance their appeal by offering innovative jewelry and watches that align with current fashion trends. The strategic selection of inventory helps attract a broader customer base and supports revenue growth.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Investing in Proper Shipping Solutions is Crucial
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Jewelry sellers invest in advanced shipping solutions to ensure the secure delivery of high-value items like jewelry and watches. Proper packaging and reliable carriers help mitigate the risk of loss or damage, which is crucial for reducing losses and maintaining consumer trust and satisfaction.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Online retailers in this industry sell a variety of jewelry, including fine, fashion and costume jewelry, as well as a wide range of watches.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on wealthy consumers or households?
FAQs.answer: While the fine jewelry segment relies on wealthy consumers, other product segments, such as fashion and costume jewelry, are able to appeal to a wide range of customers due to their lower price points.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: The price of gold and silver directly affects demand for jewelry and watches, as they are largely seen as a discretionary purchase. Depending on the situation, gold price increases can be positive or negative for sellers, as it may encourage consumers to purchase more jewelry, but it also means the product is sold at a lower price.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Larger and well-known operators benefit from working directly with jewelry manufacturers to reduce purchase costs. Additionally, some companies are vertically integrated and therefore cut down significantly on purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Due to the nature of the industry, online stores have benefited from the rise of online sales over the past few years. Additionally, online sellers benefit from consumers becoming more comfortable with purchasing expensive items online.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Operators have introduced new technology, such as electronic data interchange (EDI), which permits for the exchange of information between stores within the industry and between operators further up the supply chain.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Many states have enacted e-commerce tax laws in recent years, which puts these retailers on a more level playing field with brick-and-mortar stores.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with trade organizations, such as the Responsible Jewelry Council, to stay up to date on changing regulations and consumer trends.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Online stores generally have a cost advantage over traditional retailers, as e-commerce requires lower spending on sales associates and can reach a broader pool of customers. These trends make it possible for online sellers to be more profitable than brick-and-mortar stores.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Some online retailers offer financing for fine jewelry, such as engagement rings and other large purchases, which poses a threat to operators with consumers paying on time. Additionally, online sellers offer financing options to try and encourage consumers to purchase fine jewelry online.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Online sellers must stay on top of the rapidly changing software systems and platforms to keep pace with technology and changing consumer preferences.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations? What kinds of brands do you carry?
FAQs.answer: Retailers must establish their own brand name that has a favorable reputation among customers.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain optimum stock levels? What factors affect demand and stock levels?
FAQs.answer: Due to the high cost of some stock items, successful operators must ensure that they are not overstocked or understocked.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends to be in line with changes in competition? What products do customers tend to buy when competition is high?
FAQs.answer: Shoppers have a choice of outlets when it comes to jewelry and watch purchases. Instead of buying these items online, consumers can visit a brick-and-mortar jewelry store or department store. Physical establishments enable the shopper to see the piece of jewelry upfront and let the consumer take their purchase home immediately.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? How do you mitigate the threat of declining disposable income?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income determines consumers' ability to purchase high-value goods such as jewelry and watches.

FAQs.question: Do you track trends in the percentage of services conducted online? How has the move to online purchases of jewelry benefited your business?
FAQs.answer: The percentage of services conducted online indicates consumers' likelihood to purchase jewelry and watches over the internet. As jewelry has become rapidly available online and consumers' free time declines, shoppers are keen on purchasing these products online.
